snippet: Despite a shortage of doctors in some parts of the United States, a trend that may worsen under the new health care law, it takes years for a foreign doctor to be licensed here.
abstract: Thousands of foreign-trained immigrant physicians living in United States are languishing, despite dire need for their life-saving skills; critics argue that testing process is unnecessarily restrictive and time-consuming, especially in light of approaching deadlines under Affordable Care Act and deepening shortage of trained physicians.
lead_paragraph: Despite a shortage of doctors in some parts of the United States, a trend that may worsen under the new health care law, it takes years for a foreign doctor to be licensed here.

headline.main: Path to United States Practice Is Long Slog to Foreign Doctors
headline.print_headline: Path to United States Practice Is Long Slog to Foreign Doctors

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
